plant_info.name: Micro Tom Tomato
plant_info.description: Compact determinate tomato, ideal for small spaces and hydroponic systems. Produces small cherry tomatoes.

environmental.notes: Tolerates warmer temperatures during fruiting. Reduce humidity during flowering to improve pollination.

feeding_schedule.notes: Support fruit development with consistent feeding

watering.system_type: Deep Water Culture (DWC) with constant aeration

aeration.system: Constant air supply via air pump
aeration.notes: Continuous aeration provides oxygen to submerged roots, eliminating need for air gap. More aggressive growth than passive Kratky method.

watering.notes: Water level sensor pending. Manual monitoring required until sensor installed. DWC with continuous aeration allows roots to be fully submerged while maintaining high dissolved oxygen levels.

water_change_schedule.description: Complete reservoir drainage and refill schedule to maintain nutrient balance and prevent salt buildup

schedule.notes: Weekly water changes - gentle system for young plants, prevents nutrient imbalances
Weekly water changes - rapid growth phase, consistent nutrient uptake
Every 5 days - higher nutrient demand during flowering, prevents nutrient lockout
Every 5 days - peak nutrient uptake for fruit development, maintain optimal EC/pH

procedure.notes: Drain to sensor max (75mm = empty), refill to target (57mm = ~400ml). Allow 5min for water temperature equilibration and bubble settling before taking measurements.

emergency_triggers.water_clarity: Perform immediate change if water becomes cloudy or discolored
emergency_triggers.notes: Emergency water changes may be needed between scheduled changes if pH drifts >0.5 units from target 6.0, EC changes >20%, or visible contamination occurs.

benefits: Prevents nutrient salt buildup and imbalances
Resets pH and EC to optimal levels
Reduces risk of root diseases and algae growth

sensor_requirements.implementation_status: Pending - Manual water changes required until water level sensor fully operational
sensor_requirements.future_automation: Calendar events will trigger automated drain/fill sequences when sensor validated

air_pump.function: Continuous aeration for Deep Water Culture
air_pump.notes: Critical for DWC - maintains dissolved oxygen levels for submerged roots. Prevents root rot and enables faster growth than passive systems.

drain_pump.notes: Manual operation only until water level sensor installed

fill_pump.notes: Manual operation only until water level sensor installed

light_schedule.notes: Lights on from 6 AM to 10 PM

feeding_schedule_vegetative.notes: Monday/Wednesday/Friday feeding pattern. Adjust based on plant response.

feeding_schedule_fruiting.notes: Maintain consistent feeding through fruit development

care_instructions.pollination: Self-pollinating but benefits from gentle shaking or air circulation during flowering
care_instructions.pruning: Minimal pruning required. Remove yellow/dead leaves as needed.
care_instructions.support: No staking required due to compact growth habit
care_instructions.pests: Monitor for aphids and whiteflies. Good air circulation helps prevent issues.
care_instructions.disease: Watch for powdery mildew if humidity too high. Ensure good air movement.
care_instructions.harvesting: Pick fruits when fully colored and slightly soft. Regular harvesting encourages more fruit production.

expected_yields.notes: Determinate variety produces most fruit within 2-3 weeks

troubleshooting.slow_growth: Check nutrient concentration and light intensity. Ensure temperature in optimal range.
troubleshooting.yellowing_leaves: May indicate nitrogen deficiency or overwatering. Check EC levels.
troubleshooting.flower_drop: Usually due to temperature stress or poor pollination. Ensure good air circulation.
troubleshooting.blossom_end_rot: Calcium deficiency or inconsistent watering. Maintain stable water levels.
troubleshooting.leggy_growth: Insufficient light. Increase light intensity or duration.
